posts.post_content: Very awesome. Not many Black Mana dorks, and after a while you eventually feel guilty about casting [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)s over and over...There are a couple of Alara cards that make it so you can see a colored mana symbol in the text box of a Green Elf for each color of mana :)

posts.post_content:
I know it's an elf and not a minotaur,  
but at first glance at this card, i always see a bull's head staring at me:  
The elf's hat looks like the bull's forehead with dark fur and his face looks like the bull's snout - the eyes are the nostrils and the chin looks like the lower lip. Additionally the hat has slight 'notches' below the horns, which make it look like there are the bull's eye sockets.  
  
So when i look at Justin Sweet's art of Elves of Deep Shadow,  
i look at it at a skinny minotaur shaman that might as well be "Minotaur Reaper of Deep Shadow".  
  
I can't possibly be the only one, right?

So when i look at Justin Sweet's art of Elves of Deep Shadow,
i look at it at a skinny minotaur shaman that might as well be "Minotaur Reaper of Deep Shadow".

I can't possibly be the only one, right?

Posted By: Mode (9/8/2012 4:14:53 PM)

posts.post_content:
I dislike how this costs life to cast when [Arbor Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arbor Elf), [Avacryn's Pilgrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacryn's Pilgrim), and [Llanowar Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elf) have no such cost attached to them. I suppose this may of been implemented due to the lack of near-instant gratification options available to mana ramp black; or perhaps due to sacrificing life fitting the black culture a bit better.  
  
I'm quite happy to have another mana dork at least.
posts.html:

I'm quite happy to have another mana dork at least.

Posted By: Everlastingwords (9/6/2012 3:38:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Everlastingwords: It has a drawback to generate ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) mana because black is an enemy color to green, and it wouldn't make sense for a ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) card to produce pure black mana without some kind of flavorful drawback. Producing mana is green's specialty, not black's.  
  
 [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise) are bit different because they symbolize green's rainbow ramp efficiency and aptitude with mana in general, and [Noble Hierarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noble Hierarch)... well, Hierarch is just an overpowered card.  
 It's at least Bant, but it would've made more sense for Naya to get the undercosted one instead of [Druid of the Anima](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Druid of the Anima), since green is Naya's primary color.  
  
I'd say we're due a ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) producing [Llanowar Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elf)-type creature though, what with [Avacyn's Pilgrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn's Pilgrim) and all
posts.html:
@Everlastingwords: It has a drawback to generate mana because black is an enemy color to green, and it wouldn't make sense for a card to produce pure black mana without some kind of flavorful drawback. Producing mana is green's specialty, not black's.

Birds of Paradise are bit different because they symbolize green's rainbow ramp efficiency and aptitude with mana in general, and Noble Hierarch... well, Hierarch is just an overpowered card.
It's at least Bant, but it would've made more sense for Naya to get the undercosted one instead of Druid of the Anima, since green is Naya's primary color.

I'd say we're due a producing Llanowar Elf-type creature though, what with Avacyn's Pilgrim and all
